awd_titl_txt: Theoretical Dynamics of Collision Energy Transfer
awd_abstract_narration: Dr. Robert Parson is supported by a grant from The Theoretical                  and Computational Chemistry Program to study the dynamics of                    energy transfer which occurs in molecular collisions.                           Collision-induced energy transfer plays an important role in                    many physical and chemical problems such as population                          inversion in chemical lasers, and the spectroscopy of stellar                   atmospheres.                                                                                                                                                    Dr. Parson will study collisions between rare-gas atoms and                     highly rotationally excited diatoms, emphasizing the strong                     "quasiresonant" correlation between vibrational and rotational                  energy tranfer that has been seen in recent experiments.  A                     collision-induced resonance theory for the final state                          distributions will be developed and tested.  Subsequent studies                 will extend this approach to diatom-diatom collisions.  Studies                 of polyatomic collisions will emphasize the breakdown of the                    distinction between vibrational and rotational energy transfer.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
